issue_title: ENH: inherit numerical dtypes from abstract ones.
summary: The issue discusses the possibility of defining an abstract Python string dtype to simplify the implementation of promoters for both bytes and unicode in string dtype. There is also a discussion about the current use of dtypes in ufunc machinery and the potential clash with loops that must only match Python integers. A suggestion is made to create a general factory for abstract DTypes where you can DType.register(). The performance impact of the current setup is discussed with a suggestion to tweak things to make the exact scalar match possible without worrying about it normally.
